intro: Valeriana tripteris var. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate valerian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has pinnately compound leaves with three to five leaflets, and its roots are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
